business.headline: Want SIP success? Do this every month, says stock market expertSIP calculators do a fine job of showing projections. However, they don't account for emotions, self-doubt, or the unpredictability of life, mentioned a stock market expert.
GST Council meeting: What to expect from upcoming meet?The previous GST Council meeting took place on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Since then, many matters have remained pending.

8 key documents you must keep ready before filing your ITR for FY 2024–25One of the first documents you'll need is Form 16, which your employer gives you. It shows your total salary, how much tax was deducted, and what deductions were claimed.

EPFO raises auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh for faster fund accessIn the fiscal year 2024-25, the EPFO processed a record 2.34 crore advance claims through the auto-settlement process, marking a 161% increase compared to the previous year.
Sensex jumps 500 points: Why is stock market rising today? The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 529.55 points to 82,584.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 151.55 points to 25,195.90 as of 10:08 am.

HDB Financial opens today: Should you subscribe to the biggest IPO of 2025?HDB Financial IPO: The public listing consists of a fresh issue of 3.38 crore shares worth Rs 2,500 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 13.51 crore shares, totalling Rs 10,000 crore.
Sensex, Nifty rally continues for second day as geopolitical fears subsideThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 442.13 points to 82,497.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.10 points to 25,171.45 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to open higher? Check key trading levelsA fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel has helped calm investor nerves and improve market sentiment across Asia and other major regions.

Stocks to watch on June 25: Infosys, Union Bank, RITES, Aurobindo PharmaMarkets saw a volatile session on Tuesday as they tracked the developments in the Middle East. The benchmark indices showed sharp ups and downs before closing with small gains.

Why middle-class Indians prefer Dubai to India for buying property, explains CAIn Dubai, many middle-class Indian couples have managed to purchase two to three properties by saving meticulously over the years. These properties, which offer rental yields of 6–7%, are financed at an interest rate of just 5%, creating sustainable assets that serve as both income sources and retirement plans.

Oman becomes first Gulf nation to introduce income tax from 2028The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has already hinted that other Gulf nations may eventually need to introduce income tax too, especially as global demand for fossil fuels continues to decline.

Sensex ends 158 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Adani Ports down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 158.32 points to close at 82,055.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 72.45 points to end at 25,044.35.

entertainment.headline: Abhishek Bachchan says his first screen test was with Bipasha for RefugeeAbhishek Bachchan recalled his first screen test with Bipasha Basu for Refugee and shared his fear of auditions despite 25 years in the film industry.

Govinda announces big-screen comeback with Duniyadari, shares dance rehearsal videoGovinda is set to return to the big screen with his upcoming film 'Duniyadari'. The actor shared a rehearsal video showcasing his dance moves. The details of the film have been kept under wraps.

Vishnu Manchu visits Sri Sailam temple ahead of Kannappa release, says heart is fullActor Vishnu Manchu recently visited the Sri Sailam Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple to seek blessings ahead of 'Kannappa' release. The film is scheduled to hit theatres on June 27.

Diljit rejects Bollywood, says he lives for music: Don't need superstar's approvalDiljit Dosanjh spoke amid the boycott calls against him and the makers of 'Sardaar Ji 3' for working with a Pakistani actor in the film. He expressed his disinterest in working in the Hindi film industry, citing his deep love for music.

Aamir Khan gets emotional fan letter: My brother kept staring at screen with tearsAamir Khan received an emotional letter from a fan who shared his story of watching the film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' in theatres with his family. The fans also thanked the makers for choosing such a sensitive subject and bringing it into mainstream cinema.

Emraan Hashmi resumes shooting for Pawan Kalyan's OG after recovering from dengueBollywood actor Emraan Hashmi returned to the sets of the Telugu film 'They Call Him OG' after recovering from dengue, which was diagnosed on May 28. Directed by Sujeeth, the film stars Pawan Kalyan in the lead.

My Mama: Priyanka Chopra shares cute moment of daughter Malti watching her on TVPriyanka Chopra got emotional as her daughter Malti recognised her on TV, sweetly saying, "my mama."  She shared this moment on her Instagram Story.

Uorfi Javed criticises The Traitors co-star Sufi Motiwala for abusing her sister'The Traitors' contestants Uorfi Javed and Sufi Motiwala have locked horns on social media. While Uorfi called out Sufi for abusing her sister Dolly, Sufi accused her of targeting him on the show.

Heads of State first reviews: Priyanka Chopra impresses with John Cena, Idris ElbaThe first review of Heads of State praises Priyanka Chopra's incredible performance alongside John Cena and Idris Elba. The film is being hailed as a terrific addition to Bollywood cinema with strong international appeal.

Priyanka's gesture left Diljit emotional at Met Gala 2025. Here's what she didSinger Diljit Dosanjh recently opened up about his experience at Met Gala 2025. He recalled a sweet gesture from Priyanka Chopra that left him emotional.

AR Rahman bonds with American musician Pharrell Williams at Paris Fashion WeekMusic composer-singer AR Rahman recently connected with American musician Pharrell Williams at Paris Fashion Week. Rahman shared a glimpse of their meeting on social media.

Cobra Kai actor Martin Kove bites co-star, apologises later: Was being playfulMartin Kove has publicly apologised for an incident where he bit his 'Cobra Kai' co-star Alicia Hannah-Kim. The actor clarified the situation to fans, ensuring no harm was intended during the Karate Kid series shoot.

Brad Pitt on alcohol addiction after Jolie split: I needed rebootingBrad Pitt recently opened up about his alcohol addiction. He shared that Alcoholics Anonymous helped him overcome it after his split from actor Angelina Jolie.

Decoding Sitaare Zameen Par's no-OTT business model: Trendsetter or one-off flex?Aamir Khan's decision to release 'Sitaare Zameen Par' exclusively in cinemas has brought fresh hope to multiplexes. While urban audiences embrace the film, smaller towns show mixed reactions, highlighting changing viewing habits across India.

Did Esha Gupta date Hardik Pandya? Actor answersActor Esha Gupta addressed reports about her rumoured relationship with cricketer Hardik Pandya. She recalled her interaction and bond with Pandya during the time reports surfaced about their alleged romance.

Priyanka Chopra joins Idris Elba, John Cena at Heads of State New York premierePriyanka Chopra looked stunning in a shimmery gown as she joined Idris Elba and John Cena at the 'Heads of State' premiere.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 5: Aamir's film remains rock solid during weekdaysOn Tuesday, Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' performed as well as it did on its first Monday. The film's steady business during the weekdays establishes the audience's faith in its content.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce make red carpet debut, walk hand-in-hand in styleSinger Taylor Swift and Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce made their red carpet debut at a training camp. A video of the couple walking hand-in-hand has gone viral.

Mika Singh says desh pehle after calling Diljit Dosanjh fake amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger and rapper Mika Singh lashed out at Diljit Dosanjh for collaborating with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3' amid India-Pakistan conflict. He called him a 'fake singer'.

general news.headline: Pak working on long-range nuclear ballistic missile that can reach US: ReportA report, quoting US officials, said if Pakistan goes on to acquire an intercontinental ballistic missile, Washington would designate the country as a nuclear adversary.

Iran hangs 3 'Israeli spies', arrests 700 others day after US-brokered ceasefireIran on Wednesday executed three men, after they were convicted of collaborating with Israel's spy agency Mossad. Also, as many as 700 people were arrested for ties with the Jewish nation. These developments come a day after the US-brokered truce deal between Israel and Iran.

Pak officer who captured Abhinandan Varthaman in 2019 killed in Taliban clashPakistani Major Moiz Abbas Shah, who was involved in the 2019 capture of Indian pilot Abhinandan Varthaman, was one of two personnel killed in a clash with Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) terrorists in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region.

Why UK's lethal F-35 jet, worth $110 million, is stranded in Kerala for 10 daysSince June 14, a $110-million British F-35B stealth jet has remained grounded at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram airport after an emergency landing. Ten days on, with failed repair attempts, the jet remains in the monsoon-drenched tarmac. What will it take to get the F-35 to get it airborne?

India takes centre stage in global space alliance with Axiom-4 launchAxiom-4 is the fourth private astronaut mission organised by Axiom Space in partnership with NASA and SpaceX, marking another step toward building a permanent commercial presence in low-Earth orbit.

Five reasons why India slipped ship in their Headingley Test loss vs EnglandIndia's promising start under new Test captain Shubman Gill ended in a frustrating five-wicket loss at Headingley, as collapses, dropped catches, and a one-dimensional bowling attack allowed England to script a memorable chase.

Watch: Tears of joy as Shubhanshu Shukla's parents watch him create historyA wave of joy and pride swept through Lucknow as Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla made history with the Axiom-4 mission, launching from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre on Wednesday.

Hailing from Uttar Pradesh's capital, the Indian Air Force officer is set to travel to the International Space Station (ISS) as part of the historic mission.

Shukla's father, Shambhu Dayal, said his son's journey is a moment of immense pride, not just for Lucknow, but for the entire nation.

Zohran Mamdani, 33, wins Democratic race for NYC Mayor polls after rival concedesIndian-origin Zohran Mamdani, 33, has won the Democratic mayoral primary after rival and former Governor Andrew Cuomo conceded. Mamdani is the son of famous Indian-American filmmaker Mira Nair.

The art of not giving a f*** about Donald TrumpAfter dropping the F-bomb in front of the cameras, a visibly furious Trump retired to his chopper. It was a long, dreary walk, the MAGA hat hanging loosely in his hands. As he boarded his jet to the Netherlands to attend a NATO summit, Trump left hoping the flimsy ceasefire he had brokered would hold in the days to come.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Parliament gagged, rights suspended: PM's diatribe on Emergency anniversaryOn the 50th anniversary of the Emergency, which the Centre has decided to observe as Samvidhan Hatya Diwas, PM Narendra Modi said no Indian would ever forget how the voice of Parliament was muzzled and attempts were made to control the courts.

He's got that drive: Backup Axiom pilot Prashanth Nair on Shubhanshu ShuklaIndian Air Force pilot and Axiom Mission-4 backup astronaut Prashanth Nair shares his insights on Shubhanshu Shukla's journey to becoming India's second astronaut to go into space.

Diljit rejects Bollywood, says he lives for music: Don't need superstar's approvalDiljit Dosanjh spoke amid the boycott calls against him and the makers of 'Sardaar Ji 3' for working with a Pakistani actor in the film. He expressed his disinterest in working in the Hindi film industry, citing his deep love for music.

Live: Iran Parliament votes to suspend cooperation with US nuclear watchdogIsrael-Iran War News Live: The hostilities between Israel and Iran continued as Tel Aviv has now alleged that Tehran has violated the ceasefire, which both parties agreed upon earlier on Tuesday. The IDF said that Iran launched two ballistic missiles hours after the ceasefire deal. However, Iran denied the allegations of disrespecting the truce. Earlier too, Israel claimed that Iran launched continuous missile attacks despite US President Donald Trump announcing that the two countries had reached a ceasefire agreement early on Tuesday.

US intel says Iran strikes only delayed nuke programme, Trump calls it fake newsA US intelligence report said airstrikes ordered by President Donald Trump did not fully destroy Iran's nuclear sites Fordow and Natanz, and only delayed the programme by a few months. However, Trump and the White House called out the report, labelling it as "fake news".

Who is 'Big Balls'? Teen DOGE engineer quits US governmentEdward Coristine, also known as "Big Balls," is a 19-year-old technologist who recently resigned from the US government's Department of Government Efficiency after a brief and controversial stint in the US government.

Decoding Sitaare Zameen Par's no-OTT business model: Trendsetter or one-off flex?Aamir Khan's decision to release 'Sitaare Zameen Par' exclusively in cinemas has brought fresh hope to multiplexes. While urban audiences embrace the film, smaller towns show mixed reactions, highlighting changing viewing habits across India.

The fall of the iron fist: The end of Indira's EmergencyThe final part of the Democracy's Darkest Hour series charts the collapse of the Emergency, the surge in public resistance, and the lead-up to the 1977 general elections that brought India's authoritarian chapter to a close.

Norwegian man claims he was denied US entry over meme of bald JD VanceA 21-year-old tourist from Norway was barred from entering the US after immigration officials at Newark Airport found a meme of Vice President JD Vance on his phone. Mads Mikkelsen says he was deported the same day despite having no criminal record.

Gambhir backs pacers despite Leeds disaster: Building a battery for futureIndia's head coach Gautam Gambhir has called for patience with the young bowling attack after a heavy defeat in Leeds. He stressed the need to back inexperienced pacers to build a strong pace battery for the future.

James Beard winner, Tamil pride ambassador, meet Chef Vijay KumarIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, award-winning Chef Vijay Kumar shares how he serves that taste of South India in New York and also broods over the ongoing political tensions and more.

Pro-Hindu outfit member hacked to death near home in Tamil Nadu's TiruppurA 30-year-old man, who was a functionary of a pro-Hindu outfit in Tamil Nadu, was murdered near his home in Tiruppur. Three men reportedly hacked him to death around 4 am on Tuesday.

Priyanka's gesture left Diljit emotional at Met Gala 2025. Here's what she didSinger Diljit Dosanjh recently opened up about his experience at Met Gala 2025. He recalled a sweet gesture from Priyanka Chopra that left him emotional.

Mark Zuckerberg betting big on AI talent, offering Rs 860 crore salary to attract top mindsAccording to a report from WSJ, Mark Zuckerberg has been directly messaging top researchers, developers, and entrepreneurs across the world, offering them huge salary packages of up to $100 million, which is about Rs 860 crore when converted to Indian currency.

sports.headline: Sanjay Manjrekar slams tactically inept Ravindra Jadeja after Leeds lossSanjay Manjrekar has slammed Ravindra Jadeja for not using the conditions on Day 5 to his favour in the Leeds Test loss to England on Tuesday, June 24. Jadeja picked up just one wicket across both innings in the first Test.

Kuldeep for Thakur: Gavaskar backs spinner to start in BirminghamSunil Gavaskar suggested that India go on and pick Kuldeep Yadav to start in the second Test at Birmingham in place of Shardul Thakur. Despite making his return to Test cricket after two years, the all-rounder failed to impress in the opening Test at Leeds.

Gill didn't have that on-field aura: Hussain delivers brutal assessmentNasser Hussain slammed Shubman Gill's debut Test as captain and feels that he has a long way to go when it comes to matching the legacy left by the likes of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. The ex-England cricketer has also slammed Ravindra Jadeja for his poor display at Leeds.

Stokes analyses Leeds win: Knocking over Indian tail turned out to be keyEngland captain Ben Stokes believes dismissing the Indian tail was crucial in their 1st Test victory at Headingley. The win gives England a 1-0 lead while exposing weaknesses in India's bowling attack.

Not sure India believed they could get Leeds hero Ben Duckett out: Steve HarmisonSteve Harmison feels that India didn't believe they could get Ben Duckett after the England opener played a match-winning knock in the Leeds Test. Duckett scored 149 runs to guide England to the win.

India's tail not wagging: Familiar problem resurfacing under Gambhir eraIndia's lower order had a disappointing outing in the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds as they failed to capitalise on the good start by the top order. Head coach Gautam Gambhir must quickly find a solution to the problem or India will continue to be outscored against England's Bazballers.

Neeraj Chopra not happy despite winning gold in Ostrava Golden SpikeNeeraj Chopra might have won gold at the Ostrava Golden Spike, but was unhappy with his performance. Neeraj said that he needed to do better for his idol Jan Zelenzy.

Club World Cup: Benfica stun Munich, Delap opens account in Chelsea's winBenfica caused a big upset after securing a 1-0 win over the reigning Bundesliga champions, Bayern Munich, in the FIFA Club World Cup. Meanwhile, Chelsea's latest addition, Liam Delap, scored his first goal for the club in their win over ES Tunis.

Meanwhile, Chelsea's latest addition, Liam Delap, scored his first goal for the club in their win over ES Tunis.

India's Jasprit Bumrah plan won't change despite Leeds Test loss: GambhirENG vs IND: Despite India's defeat at Headingley, head coach Gautam Gambhir stood firm on their decision to manage Jasprit Bumrah's workload, confirming he will play only three Tests in the five-match series against England.

India lose Leeds Test despite 5 centuries: Anderson-Tendulkar series opener in statsHere's a look at top stats from India's crushing defeat against England in the first Test of the five-match series at Headingley, Leeds. England chased down 371 on Day 5 to hammer India by five wickets.

Olympique Lyon relegated due to financial irregularitiesOlympique Lyon has been relegated from Ligue 1 following a financial audit by the DNCG. The club plans to appeal, highlighting improved finances and recent player sales.

Win together, lose together: Gambhir won't blame individuals after Leeds lossEngland vs India: Head coach Gautam Gambhir acknowledged India the batting collapses and the ordinary catching in the first Test in Leeds. However, he said he won't point fingers at anyone in this new-look Indian side.

Shubman Gill honest after losing Leeds Test: Young team will improveShubman Gill's India fell short in the Leeds Test, but the young captain's composed, honest reflections after the loss showed maturity. With errors in fielding and collapses to address, the rebuilding process has officially begun.

Bazball strikes again: England stun India with another record 4th innings chaseEngland once again stunned India with a historic run chase in the first Test at Headingley, Leeds as they chased down 371 having five wickets in hand. It was for the second time that India were at the receiving end of England's batting masterclass.

Neeraj Chopra wins Gold in Ostrava Golden Spike event with best throw of 85.29mOstrava Golden Spike 2025: Two-time Olympic medalist continued his streak of finishing on the podium in competitions, winning gold in Czechia with a best effort of 85.29m. Neeraj finished ahead of Douw Smit of South Africa and Anderson Peters of Grenada.

Shubman Gill's new India hurt by old flaws as England chase 371 in Leeds winEngland vs India, 1st Test: England rode on Ben Duckett's fourth innings 149 to script their second-highest successful chase in Test cricket history. India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

It was for the second time that India were at the receiving end of England's batting masterclass.

Neeraj finished ahead of Douw Smit of South Africa and Anderson Peters of Grenada.

India paid the price for their shoddy fielding and lower-order batting as Shubman Gill faced defeat in his captaincy debut in Leeds.

Bow down to Lord: Shardul Thakur memes go viral after double strike in Leeds TestShardul Thakur took two wickets in as many balls to revive India's fading hopes at Headingley on Day 5 of the first Test. England rode on Ben Duckett's 149 to go for the mammoth target of 371 in the series opener.

If Virat Kohli was playing in England, he would have scored runs: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain and BCCI President Sourav Ganguly feels Virat Kohli would've scored a lot of runs in the ongoing England tour, if he had continued playing Test cricket.

Mohammed Siraj fumes in frustration after Yashasvi Jaiswal drops 4th catchENG vs IND: Mohammed Siraj's fury said it all as Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped his fourth catch of the match—this time handing Ben Duckett a life on 97, compounding India's fielding woes on a tough Day 5 at Headingley.

Ben Duckett hits 4th innings century as England flaunt Bazball in LeedsEngland vs India: Ben Duckett smashed his sixth Test century to lead England's chase on Day 5 series opener. Duckett put India under immense pressure even as the visitors were trying to defend 371 at Headingley.

Tilak Varma flaunts love for Test cricket with century on County Championships debutCounty Championships 2025: Mumbai Indians batting star Tilak Varma hit a hundred on his debut for Hampshire in the prestigious first-class tournament in England. He played a patient knock, rescuing Hampshire against Essex on Tuesday.

Mohammed at one end, Krishna at the other: Shubman Gill's stump mic quipIndia Test captain Shubman Gill's quip for fast bowlers Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj from Day 5 of the first Test against England has been going viral on social media.

Headingley crowd boos India over repeated ball change plea on Day 5India's tough morning at Headingley turned tense when repeated ball-change appeals from Shubman Gill and Shardul Thakur were met with rejection — and a chorus of boos from the Leeds crowd during England's strong opening partnership.

Dilip Doshi dies: India, England players wear black armbands in Leeds tributeFormer Indian spinner Dilip Doshi passed away on June 23 at age 77. India and England players observed a minute's silence while wearing black armbands in a tribute to the spinner on Tuesday, June 24.

Day 5 Highlights: England crush India by 5 wickets in epic chase at HeadingleyEngland (ENG) vs India (IND), 1st Test Day 5 Highlights: England chased down 371 in dominant fashion as Joe Root and Jamie Smith sealed a five-wicket win at Headingley, leaving India to rue poor fielding, wayward bowling, and a forgettable start to the Shubman Gill era.

Emma Raducanu thanks Wimbledon for blocking stalker's ticket purchaseBriton Emma Raducanu said she felt reassured about her safety after Wimbledon organisers prevented a man who had been stalking her from purchasing tickets for the Grand Slam, which begins on Monday.

Austrian GP preview: Verstappen seeks redemption, as McLaren look to extend leadThe 2025 Austrian Grand Prix takes place at Red Bull Ring with McLaren leading the championship. The race could reshape the title fight as Verstappen aims for a fifth win at his favourite track.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
